user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13 is: A pointer should point to a const-qualified type whenever possible.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of get_rq_dauth_qop:
```c
static enum MHD_DigestAuthQOP
get_rq_dauth_qop (const struct MHD_RqDAuthParam *const qop_param)
{
  if (NULL == qop_param->value.str)
    return MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_QOP_NONE;
  if (qop_param->quoted)
  {
    if (MHD_str_equal_caseless_quoted_s_bin_n (qop_param->value.str, \
                                               qop_param->value.len, \
                                               MHD_TOKEN_AUTH_))
      return MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_QOP_AUTH;
    if (MHD_str_equal_caseless_quoted_s_bin_n (qop_param->value.str, \
                                               qop_param->value.len, \
                                               MHD_TOKEN_AUTH_INT_))
      return MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_QOP_AUTH_INT;
  }
  else
  {
    if (MHD_str_equal_caseless_s_bin_n_ (MHD_TOKEN_AUTH_, \
                                         qop_param->value.str, \
                                         qop_param->value.len))
      return MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_QOP_AUTH;
    if (MHD_str_equal_caseless_s_bin_n_ (MHD_TOKEN_AUTH_INT_, \
                                         qop_param->value.str, \
                                         qop_param->value.len))
      return MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_QOP_AUTH_INT;
  }
  /* No know QOP has been detected */
  return MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_QOP_INVALID;
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
if (MHD_str_equal_caseless_s_bin_n_ (MHD_TOKEN_AUTH_INT_, \ 
                                         qop_param->value.str, \ 
                                         qop_param->value.len))
      return MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_QOP_AUTH_INT;
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 8.13 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: In the shown fragment there is no violation if qop_param is a pointer-to-const struct and value.str has type "const char *" (and the MHD_str_equal_* helpers accept const char *). That satisfies Rule 8.13. A concrete violation would occur if the struct member were declared as a non-const pointer (e.g. "char *value.str") even though it is only used for read-only comparisons here — in that case the pointer should be declared "const char *" and Rule 8.13 would be violated.
